section.title: Specification

otfield.otfielddesc: This is the length in bytes of the subtable.
Please see Note on the language field in cmap subtables in this document.
Number of character codes in subrange.
Array of glyph index values for character codes in the range.

section.para: The firstCode and entryCount values specify a subrange (beginning at firstCode, length = entryCount) within the range of possible character codes. Codes outside of this subrange are mapped to glyph index 0. The offset of the code (from the first code) within this subrange is used as index to the glyphIdArray, which provides the glyph index value.

section.title: Annotation
section.para: It is unclear whether the entryCount can be 0. We assume it can and recommend to add a sentence to that effect.

This format is very similar to format 0, in that there is an explicit list of glyph indices for a contiguous range of character code. However, there are two intersting properties: the range can be bigger than 256; and more importantly, the glyph indices are USHORT instead of BYTE. So this format can be used for byte encodings to reach glyphs other than the first 256 glyphs.
